intro: Mesembryanthemum arenosum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, making it well adapted to hot, dry climates. It is often found growing in coastal areas and sandy soils, where it can withstand harsh conditions. Mesembryanthemum arenosum is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to drought and full sun exposure.
